title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 November 2014 - XWiki
content:
<polx> has joined #xwiki  
00:09 <polx> has quit  
00:29 <abusenius> has quit  
00:34 <OSIMasson> has quit

07:56 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:27 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki

08:49 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki

09:08 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:10 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <gdelhumeau> Hello  
09:18 <gdelhumeau> I have introduced a flickering test in xqiki-platform  
09:18 <msmeria> has quit  
09:19 <gdelhumeau> I am trying to fix it, but it is not a blocker for a release IMO

09:41 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki

09:46 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki

10:26 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <gdelhumeau> (flickering test fixed)  
10:48 <tillo> has quit  
10:56 <msmeria> has quit  
10:58 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:29 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
11:50 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:06 <msmeria> has quit  
12:08 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:09 <Guest62111> has joined #xwiki  
12:09 <Guest62111> oh hi guys  
12:10 <Guest62111> i have been playing around with the demo.  does the xwiki have a hierarchical menu that allows arbitrary nesting of documents based on folder hierarchy?  
12:13 <msmeria> has quit  
12:16 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:19 <vmassol> Guest62111: this http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Dynamic+Hierarchy+Macro ?  
12:22 <lucaa> Guest62111: XWiki has a parent-child relation that can be made between pages  
12:22 <lucaa> regardless of the space they are in (if this is what you call "folder" because we use the folder icon)  
12:23 <lucaa> and then, indeed, dynamic hierarchy macro and hierarchy macro (it)  
12:23 <lucaa> can be used to display this relaton  
12:23 <lucaa> the parent-child tree  
12:24 <evalica> has quit  
12:24 <msmeria> has quit  
12:25 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:38 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:50 <Guest62111> thank you kindly  
12:50 <Guest62111> clearly i missed that  
13:16 <msmeria> has quit  
13:19 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:31 <vmassol> hmm could someone confirm a behavior?  
13:31 <vmassol> when you create a wanted link in a page  
13:31 <vmassol> and the click on it to create the page  
13:31 <vmassol> is it normal that the parent isn't set automatically?  
13:32 <vmassol> (I don't remember)  
13:41 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: hi, i'm just wondering, is there an easy way, how to obtain user field from existing LDAP connection? i'm facing this issue with group mapping, where it currently works by getting group members and comparing it against current user, which fails when the group doesn't exist in current LDAP (or user has no access to it), so i want to create alternative, which checks the groups agains memberOf attribute of user  
13:42 <Guest62111> has quit  
13:43 <msmeria> has quit  
13:44 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:51 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:12 <tmortagne> vmassol: it does not sounds normal, the parent used to be set automatically, not long ago  
14:14 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: not sure I fully understand your issue, you have a mapping configured with a group that does not exist on LDAP side ?  
14:16 <tmortagne> vmassol: works well for me in myxwiki.org (6.2.2)  
14:16 <tmortagne> so you have the issue in master ?  
14:16 <vmassol> I'm on master  
14:16 <tmortagne> sounds like a regression  
14:16 <vmassol> let's confirm first  
14:16 <tmortagne> testing on latest 6.3-SNASHOT  
14:17 <tmortagne> the one from this morning at least  
14:18 <tmortagne> vmassol: no issue for me, I get my parent  
14:18 <vmassol> ok I'll restest a bit later, thanks  
14:18 <vmassol> you're in wiki syntax right?  
14:18 <vmassol> and you create a wanted link  
14:18 <vmassol> [[label>>somethingnotexisting]]  
14:18 <tmortagne> I edit with wiki editor and put [[child]] as content  
14:18 <tmortagne> then I save and click on it  
14:18 <vmassol> ok  
14:21 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: yup, there are multiple LDAP servers, one user is member of group that is described in different LDAP server  
14:22 <tmortagne> are you using the standard LDAP authenticator ?  
14:22 <tmortagne> (since it does not support several LDAP servers)  
14:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: I must have done something wrong because it's ok too now, sorry for the false alert  
14:23 <DarkKnightCZ> no really, a little modified one... but the main code is the same one... the only part i need is to obtain values from field "memberOf", which seems to return empty set when using ldaputils.searchUserAttributesByUid  
14:24 <tmortagne> so this is a Java question on how to use XWikiLDAPUtils ?  
14:24 <DarkKnightCZ> yup  
14:25 <tmortagne> you want to get the fields named "memberOf" of the a user entry ?  
14:25 <DarkKnightCZ> yes  
14:26 <DarkKnightCZ> (because they contain the groups user is member of)  
14:26 <tmortagne> let me see, you will probably have to use directly XWikiLDAPConnection  
14:27 <tmortagne> ldaputils.searchUserAttributesByUid is getting only the fields declared in the configuration for user sync I think  
14:27 <DarkKnightCZ> well, it has an extra attribute (fields to obtain), so i just might be using it wrong  
14:28 <tmortagne> checking, long time I did not used that :)  
14:28 <tmortagne> indeed you are right that should do it  
14:28 <tmortagne> how do you call it ?  
14:28 <tmortagne> maybe the you did not set the right user uid attribute  
14:29 <tmortagne> how did you get the XWikiLDAPUtils instance ?  
14:29 <DarkKnightCZ> ha, yes, it's working correctly, damn closures in groovy :)  
14:30 <tmortagne> ok  
14:30 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, so this should solve it :) thanks  
14:31 <tmortagne> np, always good to explain what you did to someone who lost memory of how the API was supposed to work :)  
14:39 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
14:40 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
14:41 <evalica> has quit  
14:46 <tmortagne> seriously, ClassSheetBinding comes from a XAR...  
14:47 <tmortagne> we are create lots of mandatory class which contains an object of this class for most of them and it's not even generated  
14:50 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
14:51 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
14:52 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
14:52 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
14:54 <Denis> Hi Guys, on contrib documentation we actually list two convention for naming project, which are application-\* and macro-\*, but we actually want to publish an extension to allow panels to be collapsed. This is neither an application, nor a macro, actually this is a JSX activated wiki wide… which naming should we follow ?  
14:59 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
15:00 <Denis> vmassol ?  
15:01 <woshilapin> has quit  
15:03 <vmassol> good question, looks like something real small, it's a one page app without visible UI?  
15:04 <vmassol> so I guess what we call app is a set of wiki pages with a UI  
15:04 <vmassol> macro isn't an app because it has no user UI  
15:04 <vmassol> ?  
15:04 <vmassol> the nomenclature is not very good ATM  
15:05 <tmortagne> lucaa: would be great if you could list a few examples of the pages missing in XWIKI-11383  
15:05 <vmassol> I vaguely remember some discussions on thelist but I'm not sure  
15:05 <vmassol> brb  
15:05 <tmortagne> I'm debugging the nullpointer for now (but as I indicated the nullpointer happen after the actual import)  
15:06 <evalica> has quit  
15:07 <lucaa> tmortagne: I will try to remember what I saw  
15:07 <Denis> vmassol: perfectly, it is a single page, with a JMX, and I have suggested to not put it in a separate space, but in the XWiki space to benefit of the access rights given there, as a hidden document  
15:08 <tmortagne> lucaa: does not have to be all of them but at least one so that I know were to put a breakpoint since the log does not really contains much  
15:12 <lucaa> tmortagne: I added some stuff, but I don't remember exactly what was missin  
15:12 <lucaa> g  
15:12 <Denis> tmortagne, lucaa: just commented the issue  
15:12 <lucaa> I didn't even investigate too much to get details. The import had thrown exception so until I had the import right I would not investigate other stuff because it didn't make sense for me  
15:14 <tmortagne> Denis: this was done with user having admin right when it started the import, I agree that this is not a very common use case but there is no reason to get missing pages  
15:14 <Denis> if you loose the rights, it could really happen, it is not wise to cut your right under your own foot  
15:14 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
15:14 <Denis> it is by design IMO  
15:15 <tmortagne> lucaa: the fact that you had issue could have been just because of documents author not having PR  
15:15 <tmortagne> not missing documents  
15:15 <msmeria> has quit  
15:15 <tmortagne> Denis: once the import is started it does not test any right anymore  
15:15 <lucaa> tmortagne: I'm not sure. aren't those docs imported with the user from the package  
15:15 <lucaa> ?  
15:15 <Denis> reallly  
15:15 <tmortagne> the import is not written in Velocity  
15:15 <lucaa> tmortagne: also, sure, for macros sure. But how about user profile?  
15:16 <tmortagne> there is a test to see if you can import and that's all  
15:16 <tmortagne> lucaa: I don't know  
15:17 <tmortagne> but what is sure if that you can get UI issue with document not registered with the proper rights (translations for example), no need to have missing documents for this  
15:17 <lucaa> Denis: you don't know that you're cutting the branch under your feet, you're importing standard distribution from the XWiki website. also, it used to be the case before DW, this is how you'd install XWiki, it was working and you'd get a message at the end. Why change that to worse?  
15:17 <lucaa> tmortagne: iirc it was more than translations, like missing sheets & all  
15:18 <tmortagne> maybe user sheet need PR for some reason  
15:18 <tmortagne> I'm not really the expert here  
15:18 <lucaa> tmortagne: maybe, but should we try to figure that out?  
15:18 <tmortagne> but without an actual missing document the only bug I can see is the one with the import report generation  
15:18 <tmortagne> so I will work on this one for now  
15:18 <lucaa> also, community, don't forget that thjere is a beautiful class caller XWiki,RequiredRights which you can add to a document to mark that it needs programming rights...  
15:19 <lucaa> \*called  
15:19 <tmortagne> lucaa: I can try to figure out a bug sure, but right now I'm not even sure there is actually missing documents  
15:20 <Slashman> has quit  
15:20 <lucaa> tmortagne: did you try the case?  
15:20 <tmortagne> I know for sure that some document don't have the proper right like you always have when you import this big all in one XAR  
15:20 <tmortagne> whatever user you use  
15:20 <tmortagne> lucaa: I did try and the only thing i'm sure is that the report fail  
15:20 <tmortagne> again you can't have perfect UI right after all in one XAR import, there is another jira issue about that  
15:21 <tmortagne> this is because some document are imported before their author and things like this  
15:21 <tmortagne> but when you restart it should be ok  
15:21 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:24 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
15:25 <tmortagne> lucaa: did you used "Import as backup package" or not ?  
15:26 <lucaa> I don't remember  
15:26 <tmortagne> "Import as backup package" use the author from the XAR  
15:26 <tmortagne> when saving documents  
15:26 <tmortagne> which is usually what you want in a case like this  
15:26 <tmortagne> but it does not seems to be ticked by default  
15:27 <tmortagne> if you don't remember I guess you did not used it, so all wiki macros, jsx, translations, etc were saved with an author not having admin right  
15:27 <tmortagne> that could explain the issue you had  
15:27 <tmortagne> the graphical issues you had  
15:41 <woshilapin> has quit  
15:41 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:42 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
15:43 <lucaa> has quit

16:24 <woshilapin> Wrong chat, sorry  
16:50 <lucaa> tmortagne: I commented on XWIKI-11383 with info from a local test I just did  
16:53 <tmortagne> lucaa: ok thanks, I answered one of your question  
16:53 <tmortagne> I will change the issue title to talk about the nullpointer
